subject: Re: [junit] Set Returning method
msgSnippet: The JUnit test is detecting a real bug.  You have an invalid cast in the method body. --Nat ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
The JUnit test is detecting a real bug. You have an invalid cast in the
method body.

--Nat

On 15/01/2008, pankaj khare <pankaj.0405@...> wrote:
>
> how to write junit test case of method which are return Set or List.
>
> code of methods
>
> // for test
>
> public Set getPredecessors()
> {
> if (this.predecessors != null)
> {
> StringBuffer sbId = new StringBuffer();
> sbId.append("");
>
> for (Iterator iter = this.predecessors.iterator(); iter.hasNext();)
> {
> WorkflowStepPredecessor wsp = (WorkflowStepPredecessor) iter
> .next();
> // Lonmg ws=wsd.getPredecessorId();
> if (sbId.toString().equals(""))
> {
> sbId.append(wsp.getPredecessorStep().getWfPosition());
> } else
> {
> sbId.append(",").append(
> wsp.getPredecessorStep().getWfPosition());
> }
> }
> setPredecessorsIds(sbId.toString());
> }
> return this.predecessors;
> }
>
> // setter method
>
> public void setPredecessors(Set predecessors)
> {
>
> this.predecessors = predecessors;
> }
>
> i got class cast exception
> if i write following code
>
> public void testGetPredecessors()
> {
> //MockControl controlPd=MockControl.createControl(Set.class);
> //Set mockPd=(Set)controlPd.getMock();
> //mockPd.add("ok");
> //mockPd.toString();
> //controlPd.setReturnValue("ok");
> //controlPd.replay();
>
> predecessors=new TreeSet();
> predecessors.add("pk");
> predecessors.toString();
>
> ws.setPredecessors(predecessors);
> Assert.assertEquals("pk",ws.getPredecessors());
> //controlPd.verify();
> }
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
